lines.Vitus: "I wonder what Cerkles thinks about being summoned?"

lines.Volesus: "Say no more, I'm sure there's plenty we can learn from Cerkles no matter what we ask."

lines.Cerkles: "I- Ah, could be dressed as appropriately as I need to be."

lines.Vitus: "Calm down Cerkles, we only want to talk to you for a bit."

lines.Volesus: "And you might as well change. Then you can get in the water with us."

lines.Cerkles: "I suppose it could be even more inappropriate to rebuke your suggestion."

lines: (The bear moved faster than we've ever seen him move, turning a corner and leaving our sight.)

lines.Vitus: "Even a legendary hero can be like that, huh?"

lines.Volesus: "I think he's legendary due to his capacity to help people."

lines: (Cerkles returned in his towel, cheeks blushing and shoulders twitching.)

lines.Vitus: "We just want to know how it feels to be summoned."

lines.Cerkles: "You mean getting ripped away from your work without a moment's notice, to be asked to do things that you don't know if you can morally support, anytime, forever?"

lines.Vitus: "If you want, we could arrange it so that we can warn you ahead of time before we summon you."
"So you don't have to live in worry."

lines.Cerkles: "Are you saying that just because my statement pressured you into thinking that?"
"My magic saves people's lives, and we're living in a time of war."

lines.Vitus: "The nature of your abilities does put you in a very hard position."

lines.Volesus: "...but could you at least make up your mind on whether you're going to be selfish or selfless?"
"I bet we can think of some sort of middle ground, here..."

lines.Vitus: "...I thought going to the bathhouse was supposed to be relaxing."
